title: Why all of a sudden IS FIREFOX INTERFERING WITH SITES I have gone to in the past with no problem?
content:
I've been trying to pay Home Depot for a week and, even though I used to be ALLOWED to go to Home Depot.com now Firefox is blocking me. This is the message I get when Firefox INTERFERES with my browsing choices (I CAN'T CONTACT WEBSITE TO WARN THEM BECAUSE FIREFOX IS BLOCKING ME

Secure Connection Failed

An error occurred during a connection to www.homedepot.com. SSL peer reports incorrect Message Authentication Code.

Error code: SSL_ERROR_BAD_MAC_ALERT 

   The page you are trying to view cannot be shown because the authenticity of the received data could not be verified.    Please contact the website owners to inform them of this problem.
creator: kcsummer111

title: PayPal Pay window pop-up will not load on any merchant site in Firefox browser only
content:
Currently on Firefox 104.0.1, but I updated it trying to fix this problem. I had 98 or something before.

When I am on any merchant site and I choose their pay by PayPal button, a PayPal pop-up window opens, saying I am recognized on this computer, but then it never finishes loading to the payment options. Actually, I see the options there, but they are greyed out and very blurry, so I cannot make them out and select any of them does not work either.

I have deleted cookies multiple times; ensured paypal.com is allowed pop-ups as well as the merchant websites. I upgraded Firefox. I only have one add-on listed, Amazon Assistant, and I had this problem before I installed it. I have tried every solution I can find on line, although all postings are at least a year old or older, but nothing has worked.

I use to be able to get it to finish loading if I closed the pop-up and reopened it and refreshed the merchant page, but that is no longer working.

It worked on Edge. I hate Edge.

Firefox, please help fix this!
creator: CatherineHP

title: Crash still happens in Troubleshoot Mode. See Crash ID below.
content:

Please advise what to do next. Thanks.
creator: italiangm

title: Problema no som com certos vídeos
content:
Olá,

Desde as 2 últimas actualizações (não tenho a certeza se começou na 103), que quando ouço o som de um vídeo no Firefox, o mesmo tem quebras constantes, aparentemente, de volume. Já desinstalei e voltei a instalar o Firefox mas o problema persiste. Isto só se nota quando corro um vídeo de ruído constante, como o "brown noise". Com vídeos normais isso não se nota. Tirei que instalar uma versão mais antiga ou há solução para isto? Noutros browsers não tenho esse problema.

Cumprimentos Vitor
creator: vhtas

title: missing icon for OneTab and 1Password
content: I fear I will use the wrong terminology -- computers are absolutely not my specialty. I have OneTab and I LOVE it! I still have the OneTab icon/link on the top LEFT of my screen. Clicking that drops down a list of sites that I can load. But the identical icon/link that used to appear on the top RIGHT side of the screen is gone. I was able to click this when I was shutting down my system. Clicking it would close the open sites and put them in the list I can access on the left. (I told you I don't know the right names for things. Sorry!!!) I can't use OneTab without that right-side icon/link. I also lost the 1Password icon/link. How do I get these back? I still have the Pocket icon/link, the download arrow, the Firefox account icon, and the "hamburger" on the right, but I really want the OneTab and 1Password clickable icon/links. Simple instructions, please! Thank you!
creator: sajudy2

title: Can NOT download .zip archives from usual spot on my iMac, I CAN download the images
content:
I frequent Creative Fabrica a lot, I have had a subscription there for well over a year and never had any problem downloading anything, never had so much as a warning about the website. This website is larger than Creative Market. I purchased the ability to download in a subscription there, my payments are all made on time.

Even then, I am trying to download free "daily gifts" (fonts & graphics), and this is the first time I have tried on my iMac, but FireFox does nothing, and I cannot download the .zip archive, even though I can download the image files.

I have been downloading from elsewhere across the internet just fine. I usually use FireFox because I like it better than Safari (and a lot more than Chrome or Chrome Edge), until this issue.

So, what's the deal?

I heard about restarting in safe mode, but have no idea how, I always have such an issue getting FireFox to restart for updates, already (and why doesn't it offer the button to do just that?).
creator: DomainHostmaster

title: Firefox browser page
content: After recent update all but one of my chosen website icons have been replaced by unwanted ones. Suggestions, please, on how to restore the page
creator: friedman.ezrah

title: Firefox closes/crashes when scrolling up with scrollbar
content:
I'm repeatedly having an issue where if I use the scroll bar to scroll up quickly my firefox closes, but it doesn't get reported as a crash. If I immediately try to open firefox again it tells me the old one is still running but not responding so I have to click close to open a new session. This has been happening for weeks now.

I considered that maybe there's some kind of interaction with the exit button since it is above the scroll bar and this only happens when I try to scroll up fast and far, but I've not been able to recreate this issue manually, releasing right click doesn't close the browser even if I hover over the x so I have no explanation on why this happens.

Please help, thanks.
creator: vash854
